CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier, September 24, 1955, pg. 1, reads: "Thelma (Dolly) Taylor...mauled by police." Portion of article reads: "...The arrest and cruelly brutal treatment of Miss Taylor [age 18, of 1325 Stedman Street, North Side] occurred after she had appealed to two police officers to protect her against molestation from two white "smart guys" [William Briggs age 24, and Donald Jones age 26] who had insulted her...."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thelma (Dolly) Taylor wearing light colored dress with triangular plaid collar and skirt, holding clothing ripped by police officers, and seated on plastic covered chair, possibly in her home at 1325 Stedman Street, North Side
